title: DevSecOps as a first-class capability
summary: Bake security, compliance, and quality controls into delivery paths so modernization can move fast safely.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Getting code to production becomes a bottleneck without automated security, compliance, and quality gates. Manual processes don't scale and introduce risk.
whenToUse: Always — you should always have great DevSecOps
Multiple teams need standardized, consistent delivery paths
You need DevOps to never be in the way of shipping
Security and compliance checks must be automated and shift-left
You want to eliminate late-stage security surprises
whenNotToUse: A short-lived spike with no intent to productionize

gotchas: Not taking this seriously — problems getting code to production are a business liability
Not stopping to automate things that should be automated — manual gates don't scale
Not getting your security officer involved early when building security protocols and governance
Not being creative — you can stand up databases for integration testing, entire environments for performance testing, with tight developer feedback loops
Not leveraging AI and GitHub Actions to solve delivery problems in new ways
Security exceptions become invisible risk over time
Overly heavy gates slow delivery and frustrate teams
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Do process engineering first. Step back, understand how you want delivery to work, then build toward that vision. Be creative with ephemeral environments, AI-assisted reviews, and automated testing. Get senior leadership buy-in that secure, fast delivery is a competitive advantage. Automate the basics (scans, policies) and focus humans on true risk decisions.

complexity.rationale: Tooling exists and is mature. The complexity comes from organizational alignment, multi-team adoption, and building a centralized platform that serves everyone.
complexity.teamImpact: Requires a centralized DevOps team to build the platform, an enablement team to teach teams how to plug in, and senior-level buy-in that secure delivery is critical.
complexity.skillDemand: Security engineering, CI/CD expertise, GitHub Actions/Azure DevOps fluency, policy-as-code, and enablement skills.
complexity.operationalDemand: High — directly affects production safety, velocity, and confidence. Must be reliable and fast.
complexity.toolingDemand: GitHub Advanced Security, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, automated testing, secrets management, environment gating, rollback mechanisms.

starterDiagram.title: Automated secure delivery pipeline
starterDiagram.description: Code flows through automated security, quality, and compliance gates before reaching production.
nodes: Build → Unit Tests → Security Scan (GitHub Advanced Security)
Integration Tests → Ephemeral Environment → Performance Tests
Policy Validation → Secrets Check → Compliance Gates

realWorldExample.context: A ticketing company undergoing modernization needed to move fast without sacrificing security, compliance, or quality. Multiple teams were delivering features daily.
realWorldExample.approach: Built a tight DevSecOps system with GitHub Actions, GitHub Advanced Security, automated testing, environment gating, and automatic rollback. All security, governance, and compliance checks were automated and shift-left. Developers could click a button to deploy from the main branch at any time. The enablement team trained all product teams on how to plug into the platform.
realWorldExample.outcome: Teams deployed code 10+ times a day without issue. Developers could deploy while at dinner without worry. The system automatically handled rollback if production issues occurred. This became a massive enabler for delivering features faster during their modernization journey. Zero manual gates, zero late-stage surprises.
